greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(k,m) = number of occurrences of k in the last section of the set of partitions of (6 + m).
comment: Sub-triangle of A182703 and also of A194812. Note that the sum of every row is also the number of partitions of 6. For further information see A182703 and A135010.
formula: T(k,m) = A182703(6+m,k), with T(k,m) = 0 if k > 6+m.
example: For k = 1 and  m = 1; T(1,1) = 11 because there are 11 parts of size 1 in the last section of the set of partitions of 7, since 6 + m = 7, so a(1) = 11. For k = 2 and m = 1; T(2,1) = 3 because there are three parts of size 2 in the last section of the set of partitions of 7, since 6 + m = 7, so a(2) = 3.
program: (PARI) P(n)={my(M=matrix(n,n), d=6); M[1,1]=numbpart(d); for(m=1, n, forpart(p=m+d, for(k=1, #p, my(t=p[k]); if(t<=n && m<=t, M[t, m]++)), [2, m+d])); M}
xref: Always the sum of row k = p(6) = A000041(6) = 11.
The first (0-10) members of this family of triangles are A023531, A129186, A194702-A194705, this sequence, A194707-A194710.
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Feb 05 2012
ext: Terms a(22) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Feb 19 2020
